alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Claiborne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:41AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Claiborne and northeastern Campbell Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 641 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lot, or 9 miles southeast of Williamsburg, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Jellico, White Oak, Indian Mountain State Park and Clairfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
